reg_pit.acttitle: Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act
reg_pit.title: Prescribed Health Care Profession Regulation

change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 419/2008, effective April 1, 2009.

reg.acttitle: Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act
reg.title: Prescribed Health Care Profession Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 422/2008, March 1, 2009]

section.sectiontext: Midwifery is a prescribed health care profession for the purposes of the definition of "practitioner" in section 1 of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act.

Pharmacy is a prescribed health care profession for the purposes of the definition of "practitioner" in section 1 of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act only for the purposes of prescribing the following drugs for use for emergency contraception:

Nursing as a nurse practitioner is a prescribed health care profession for the purposes of the definition of "practitioner" in section 1 of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act.
Optometry is a prescribed health care profession for the purposes of the definition of "practitioner" in section 1 of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act.

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Pharmacists, Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 363, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 1]
